Recipe.title: Dutch Oven Klondike Chili
Recipe.Description:
This is Ransom's second Chili recipe. The first one was really good, but it was complex and actually had to be started the day before you wanted to eat it. (Additionally, most people found it to be too spicy.) (See Entrees / Slow Cooker: Stealth-Attack Chili.)
This recipe is geared towards quick preparation, and has actually won the first-place award at multiple Boy Scout district Dutch-oven chili cook-offs!

section.instruction: Use a 12" Dutch Oven. (VanOrman's deep 14" Dutch Oven will easily hold a double batch.)
Peel Onion and slice into disks that are ½" thick, then cut the disks into quarters.
Cut top off of each of the Peppers, slice them in half, then remove and discard the seeds.
Cut the Peppers into chunks that are ½" × ½".
In the Dutch Oven, combine Onions and Hamburger and cook until Hamburger is browned.
Add all of the rest of ingredients.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.

Notes.note: Cilantro purchased from the grocery store comes in a bunch of stems. The leaves need to be picked from the stems and the stems can be discarded. Then the leaves need to be chopped.

The Onions and Peppers should be cut into chunks that are as large as possible, but still easy to get into a spoon.
1" × 1" is too big.
⅛" × ⅛" is too small.
(We generally use ½" × ½", but don't hesitate to make them bigger if you want.)
After chopping the Peppers, be very careful to not rub your eyes! Even after washing your hands thoroughly, the spicy oils will still be there, and it will hurt!

To make cooking faster and easier, you can do some prep ahead a time: (Do this for Scout outings.)
Cut up Onions
Cook Hamburger and Onions, let cool, then put in a Ziplock bag.
Cut up Peppers, Prepare Cilantro, and put them all in a Ziplock bag.
Mix spices and put in a sealed container

Modifications.modification: One or more of the cans of Sliced and/or Diced Tomatoes can be replaced with cans of Stewed Tomatoes of the same size, but cut them up with the spoon as you cook.

Serve with any combination of:
A dollop of Sour Cream
Grated Cheddar or Pepper-Jack Cheese
Corn Chips

For a spicier chili add:
Chili Powder ½-2 Tablespoons
Cayenne Pepper ½-1 teaspoon
